devEnvironment.assemblyScriptNoteDesc: AssemblyScript uses TypeScript-like syntax, lowering the barrier for JavaScript developers. However, it may not achieve the same level of performance optimization as Rust or C++.

advancedFeatures.title: Advanced Features: SIMD, Threads, GC
advancedFeatures.description: Vector operations, multithreading, and garbage collection integration
advancedFeatures.simdExplain: SIMD processes multiple data with a single instruction, significantly improving performance in image processing, scientific computing, etc.
advancedFeatures.gcExplain: WasmGC integrates with the browser's garbage collector, improving Wasm support for managed languages (Java, Kotlin, Dart, etc.).

optimization.typedArrayDesc: Share Wasm memory directly to reduce data copying overhead.

debuggingSecurity.title: Debugging and Security
debuggingSecurity.description: Source map debugging, testing, and understanding the security sandbox
securityPoints: Memory isolation: Each Wasm instance accesses only its own linear memory
No system calls: No direct file system or network access
JavaScript gateway: All external interactions go through JS
debuggingSecurity.rustSafetyDesc: Rust's memory safety guarantees are preserved when compiled to WebAssembly.
debuggingSecurity.finalNoteDesc: WebAssembly runs in the same security sandbox as JavaScript. However, complex Wasm modules may contain logical vulnerabilities, so only use modules from trusted sources.
